intro: Casearia holtzii, commonly known as the Brazilian beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Salicaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its striking clusters of violet-blue berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are small and greenish-white. The berries, which are edible, are a notable feature of the plant and attract various birds and small mammals.
